page.title: 10KNIVETONWOOD FARM
page.content: Knivetonwood Farm is a typical local farm.It covers about one hundred acres of land.There are 35 fields. The farm is really a dairy farm although recently the farmer has started to keep more sheep and lambs.He has had to sell some cows to cut down on milk production. The cows produce about 7000 litres of milk per week which is collected by bulk tanker. There are over 200 animals on the farm of which 40 are sheep and 60 are lambs. The cows are Friesians and Herefords and there are six Limousin bulls.
